thread.title: HILARIOUS: Watch Adam Lambert & Alan Carr recreate Bohemian Rhapsody
thread.title_full: HILARIOUS: Watch Adam Lambert & Alan Carr recreate Bohemian Rhapsody

title: HILARIOUS: Watch Adam Lambert & Alan Carr recreate Bohemian Rhapsody
text:
HILARIOUS: Watch Adam Lambert & Alan Carr recreate Bohemian Rhapsody HILARIOUS: Watch Adam Lambert & Alan Carr recreate Bohemian Rhapsody ADAM LAMBERT and Alan Carr recreate Queen's classic Bohemian Rhapsody video as the US star releases new single Another Lonely Night. PUBLISHED: 15:32, Tue, Oct 20, 2015 | UPDATED: 17:04, Tue, Oct 20, 2015 CHANNEL 4 Adam Lambert is always up for a laugh 
We see a little silhoutte of a man. 
Oh yes, Alan Carr and Adam Lambert made us fall off our seats with a brilliantly irreverant but loving take on the ultimate karaoke song, Queen's mighty Bohemian Rhapsody. 
You might want to put your ear plugs in now... Related articles VIDEO: In bed with Adam Lambert – the star's SEXIEST video yet as... 
The hilarious moment happened during the UK comedian's interview with Lambert on Chatty Man. 
Carr introduced his superstar guest with the cheeky line: "He's the pop diva who's so fierce he even manages to put the queen into Queen." 
Lambert, of course, is the regular front man for the legendary band, as well as having international huge solo success. 
But this must surely have been the highlight of his career, so far. CHANNEL 4 Adam Lambert and Alan Carr do Bohemian Rhapsody CHANNEL 4 We see a little silhouette of a man (or two)... 
During the interview Carr also decided to start an online campaign to help his famous guest headline Glastonbury next year, while Lambert speaks up proudly about his natural red-headed status. 
"You know we have secret powers," he smiles. "We can go for hours." 
Unable to keep a straight face, he then hung his head and groaned, "I can't believe I Just said that." 
But the highlight of the night was indoubtedly their riotous reinvention of the all-time Queen classic. 
It's not the first time that the US star has joked around on TV. In a recent scene with James Corden, Lambert let loose with a performance of Queen's We Are The Champions. CHANNEL 4 Where's Brian May when you need him? CHANNEL 4 
But the latest hilariosu clip has the added advantage of cutting edge technical wizardry. Well, kind of... 
It opens with the silhouettes of Lambert and Carr, before we see the bespectacled comedian in a fright wig as the music kicks in. 
Fantastically out of tune, Carr squawks away merrily as Lambert tries to keep a straight face and we are treated to a thrilling hommage to the iconic Bohemian Rhapsody video split screen effects. 
We're still not sure that it tops Adam Lambert's impression of Kermit in our recent video exclusive , but it's certainly enough to make anyone want to do the fandango. 
An electrifying Carr guitar solo completes the epic performances and we can safely say that a rock star is NOT born. 
Lambert is back to business in his new video for Another Lonely Night. 
It’s the second single taken from his new album, The Original High, which debuted in the US Billboard Top 3, the UK Top 10 and the Worldwide Top 3. 
The video features transgender actress and Youtube star Gigi Gorgeous who has amassed an incredible 200m views online. 
Adam, himself, has just returned from headlining Rock in Rio with Queen. 
Adam Lambert's new single Another Lonely Night is out now. Related articles
